sen.j: 応永年間（1394年～1428年）北朝 (日本)4代後光厳天皇の皇女見子内親王が北朝3代崇光天皇の御所で一条通西洞院通にあった入江殿を寺に改め、足利義満の娘性仙尼を開山としたのに始まる。
sen.e: It started when Imperial Prince Kenshi, a princess of the 4th Emperor Gokogon of Northern Court of Japan, remade Irie-dono Palace, which had been an Imperial Palace of the 3rd Northern Court Emperor Suko and located on Ichijo-dori Street and Nishinotoin-dori Street, into a temple and Seisen ni, a daughter of Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA, became its kaisan (a founder of temple as the first chief priest) during Oei era (1394 - 1428).
sen.cmt: 「一条通西洞院通」は「Ichijo-dori Street and Nishinotoin-dori Street」と致しました。

sen.j: 後柏原天皇の代に三時知恩寺と称されるようになったが、これは宮中における1日6回の勤行のうち昼間の3回をこの寺で行うようになったことによるとされる。
sen.e: It came to be called Sanji Chion-ji Temple when Gokashiwabara was the Emperor, which is said to have started because three devotional exercises, which were performed daytime out of 6 devotional exercises performed a day in the Imperial court, began to take place in this temple.
